page.title: 04THE ARMED FORCES IN TIDWORTH
page.content: Tidworth has had a military presence since 1903 when the first barracks were built. At that time there were four Cavalry and four Infantry barracks and whilst many of the main buildings remain today extensive rebuilding is planned. The 1920's saw more troops coming into the area and the facilities were improved. Today's Garrison comprises the HQ 1st Infantry Brigade,two Armoured Regiments,an Engineer Regiment and two Infantry Battalions. They are supported by units of the RAMC,RAOC,REME,RMP,RAEC, RADC and RPC. Units from Tidworth go on detachment to Northern Ireland, Cyprus and the Falkland Islands. Many exercises take place on Salisbury Plain and the training areas around Tidworth but soldiers may also go to other parts of the United Kingdom or abroad to Germany,Denmark or Norway.
